column4: anyone what wifi cards that are working good with ubuntu 12.04
i use a cisco usb wifi dongle
Model AM10
ah
if you are looking into wireless stuff..i would go D-Link. Cause they support linux straight out
all i know is that my wifi dongle does not work in kernel 2.6
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1973201
i have no problems with my wireless devices. it's always good to research what works before purchasing
ive noticed on my laptops wireless card in linux, sometimes does not like certain wifi protection
change the channel on your router
all devices will pick up on whatever channel you set your router to
say like you turn on the radio, and one channel is fuzzy..but the next channel sounds great. That is pretty much all it is doing
that's the fun of linux. you actually feel like your learning when you use it. Also, when you get stuff working. you feel very much accomplished
that's why windows feels boring to me
i have had my phones 4g be faster than wifi before..haha
how far are you from your router?
you got walls between you and the router? cause my router is down the hall in one room, and i get two bars
That is like not even 10 feet
also ive noticed, about wireless...dont put it above or below a microwave...you turn that on, and it drops your connection
hmm
you could try sudo iwconfig wlan0 rate 54M
i had peppermint os three on here before i put ubuntu on it. i noticed the download rates were faster.  odd thing
all i can say is keep pushing through with it until you can get something better man
